55625.name: Internet Tycoon
55625.description:
Be the Internet Tycoon. Attract people to your Sites and build your own digital empire,
even if you may have to play dirty against the competitors

There are 4 types of cards:


Sites: your source of money, used to attract and maintain people connected to your services;
Upgrades: cards used to raise your Site capacity, increasing the max number of users, your defense against Hackers and Crackers and the incoming you get from the visits;
Peopleware: represent experts hired to defend your digital empire or to attack the competitors’ infrastructure;
Event: carts turned after each round putting more emotion in the game


In your turn, player can buy cards, put new Sites on-line, upgrade it, and attract people (from the Internet or the competitors Sites). When no one is looking, you can cut off the power from the computer from the others.

At the end of the game, win the player who has the highest number of people navigating in his Sites.


Seja um Magnata da Internet. Atraia usuários para seus Sites e construa seu império digital, mesmo que para isso seja preciso jogar sujo contra os concorrentes!

Existem 4 tipos de cartas:


Sites: sua fonte de recurso, usado para atrair e manter usuários conectados em seus serviços;
Atualizações (Upgrades): cartas usadas para ampliar a capacidade dos Sites, aumentando a quantidade máxima de usuários, sua defesa contra ataques de Hackers e Crackers, número de usuários e valor recebido por visita;
Pessoas (Peopleware): representam os especialistas contratados para defender seu império digital ou para atacar a infra-estrutura dos concorrentes;
Eventos: cartas viradas no final de cada Rodada colocando mais emoção no jogo.


No seu turno o jogador compra cartas, coloca no ar novos Sites, atualiza os já existentes, atrai usuários (da Internet ou do Site dos concorrentes). Quando ninguém estiver olhando, vale até tirar o Servidor dos outros da tomada.

No final do jogo, vence quem tiver o maior número de usuários navegando em seus Sites.

55626.name: The Western Countries Trail Map
55626.description:
From the Back of the Folder:
The Western Countries

Fantasy worlds are vast, with many strange places to discover and marvel, but only the best of travelers find their way by the stars alone. For the wise and the true adventurers, only Trail Maps will do.

TM1 shows the nations in the western region of the D&D game Known World, from Glantri to Rockhome, and as far north as the Ethengar plains to the steamy Isles of Ierendi. Discover details about the weather, trail conditions, astronomy, and much more.

All this come in 8-miles per hex Gazetteer style, on an impressive 36" by 57", highly detailed, full-color map.

55627.name: D&D Fast-Play Game
55627.description:
From Inside front cover

Welcome to the Dungeons & Dragons(R) Fast-Play Game. This booklet is an introduction to the Advanced Dungeons & Dragons(R) game - the world's most popular roleplaying game. If you're an experienced player who knows all this stuff, share it with someone who hasn't played before. If you're interested in how to play the D&D game, read on.

55628.name: The Eastern Countries Trail Map
55628.description:
From the Back of the Folder:
The Eastern Countries

Fantasy worlds are vast, with many strange places to discover and marvel, but only the best of travelers find their way by the stars alone. For the wise and the true adventurers, only Trail Maps will do.

From the northern reaches of Vestland to Thyatis, and as far east as the mighty Isle of Dawn, TM2 picks up where TM1 ended. TM2 shows the eastern D&D Game Known World and brings new facts about traveling costs, rates of exchange, universities, geopolitical intelligence, and more!

All this come in 8-miles per hex Gazetteer style, on a grand 36" by 57", highly detailed, full-color map.

55629.name: Dungeon (Issue 46 - Mar 1994)
rpgissuearticle: The Iron Orb of the Duergar
55629.description:
Volume VIII number 4

Cover by Scott Burdick

Issue quote:
"From the wrath of the Northmen, O Lord, deliver us."
--Unknown Frankish monk

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

55630.name: Road of Kings
55630.description:
Back Cover:
Cursed to the Night

Caines Curse is a grand responsibility that we dare not shirk. We have been made into the highest order of being on this Earth and we must accept it. But rulership is not simply a matter of inheritance - it demands will to uphold this dark legacy. You are a vampire, but are you strong enough to be a Scion?

Destined to Rule It

In the second of the Road Books for Dark Ages: Vampire, players find all the secret ways and hidden rites of the Road of Kings, the vampiric faith that teaches the ways of honor and power. From dark tyrants and Machiavellian schemers to ashen knights and vampire-kings, the Scions come into their own in the War of Princes.

Road of Kings includes:

The history, beliefs, and current practices of the Scions
Story hooks and character templates suitable for all Dark Ages: Vampire characters
New Merits and Flaws, Discipline techniques, and advice for playing Scion characters

55631.name: Adventurers Club (Issue 17 - Summer 1991)
rpgissuearticle: Masters of the Spirit World (Shaman Magic)
55631.description:
User Summary:

Adventurers Club #17 features an Old West cover and contains a couple of articles for Western Hero. This issue also features an article by Steve Long (who would later go on to be the Line Developer for Hero Games).

Issue appeared in Summer 1991. The format of this issue is a little larger than those that appear immediately before and after it.

Departments

- 'Nuff Said by John Brunkhart
- Superhype! by Monte Cook
- The Plot Thickens: The nicest hero around is wanted by the Law by Jo Lori Drake
- Stump the Heroes: We answer a few quick questions about speedsters by Rob Bell
- Treasure Chest: Two extraordinary swords by David Mercier

Features

- Silly Martial Arts: Want to learn "Kid Fu?" How 'bout Stooge-jutsu? Nyuk! Nyuk! Nyuk!: by Aaron Allston
- Ancient Chinese Secrets: A dozen deadly new martial arts styles by Stephen S. Long
- Ninja Hero Errata: Cleaning up Ninja Hero by Aaron Allston
- Morituri te Salutant! (Gladiators): Combat in the arena for Fantasy Hero by Mark Bennett
- "Hi-Ho, Silver, Away!": The Greatest Western Heroes that Never Lived by Matt Forbeck
- Masters of the Spirit World (Shaman Magic) by Mark Bennett

rpgitemversion: Libro del Clan Salubri PDF version
55632.name: Clanbook: Salubri
55632.description:
From the publisher:

It Is the Way of War

Saulot is dead destroyed by the foul Usurper. Everywhere the servants of the Tremere hound the remaining Salubri, condemning them to the pyre or the stake. And while the land cries out for a healers touch, it is only by turning to the sword that the Salubri can survive.

It Is the Way of Healing

In the last solo Clanbook for Vampire: The Dark Ages, the secrets of the reclusive Salubri are revealed. How can they strike back at the Tremere Usurpers? What powers can they bring to bear in their own defense? What secrets do they carry that allow them even the hope of survival? And why do the other clans turn away from their plight? The answers to these questions and more await.

55633.name: Spoils of War
55633.description:
Back Cover:

To the Victors Go the Spoils

Whether its a Holy War or battle of succession, strife brings opportunity. The inhabitants of the Dark Medieval, mortal and supernatural, are rarely satisfied with what they have. Call it what you like a righteous cause or an ancient grudge war is hell, but the rewards can be worth the risks. Do you have the courage, the intelligence and the skill to lead an army to victory?

The Victor Writes History

Dark Ages: Spoils of War is the sister title to Right of Princes and contains information on how to raise an army, attack and overtake a foes holdings, and beat an enemy through stealth, diplomacy and assassination. It contains information on both the historical and supernatural applications of war in the Dark Medieval, and how players can turn these weapons to their characters advantage.

Spoils of War includes:

Information suitable for all four major races- vampires, mages, inquisitors, and werewolves- on the waging of war
Revisions to the mass combat system and weapons charts
The "sample Domains" from Right of Princes revisited- and torn down

55634.name: Dungeon (Issue 50 - Nov 1994)
55634.description:
Volume IX number 2

Cover by Robh Ruppel

Issue quote:
"Tiger, tiger burning bright
In the forests of the night
What immortal hand or eye
Could frame thy fearful symmetry?"
--Willam Blake, The Tiger

The table of contents is detailed in the Article list below.

55635.name: The Endless Tunnels of Enlandin
55635.description:
An old school adventure for 5-8 low-level characters.

Does your group have the nerve to explore the endless tunnels of the mage Enlandin? Many have tried and all have failed.

Module Introduction:

This adventure was originally designed using the 1978 edition Dungeons and Dragons rules. Users are invited to convert and use the adventure with whatever rules systems they prefer. One of the problems with designing adventures for older editions of Dungeons and Dragons is that there is great variation in rule sets. For example, the statistics for monsters listed in the original 1974 edition are not necessarily always the same as the statistics for monsters listed in the 1978 edition. To alleviate this problem, I have simply stated what monsters are suggested for each location and given some hit points and treasure as well as a few suggestions for arms and tactics. Individual dungeon masters can use whatever rule set they like after having made appropriate adjustments.

[...]

A few words of warning to adventure connoisseurs: This is a simple, open-ended dungeon that conforms to the basic D&D stereotype of what a "starter" dungeon should be. It does not involve complicated plot twists or deep character development.

55636.name: The Erciyes Fragments
55636.description:
From the publisher:

The Complete Book of Nod Has Been Found
A young Cappadocian receives a mysterious invitation to a fear-shrouded monastery. There he finds fragments of the original Book of Nod in a language that has been dead for thousands of years. Who has led him to this place? What has he uncovered? And why has he been chosen to transcribe the words of one who could be Caine himself?

Who Found it and Why?
Written by noted science-fiction novelist C.S. Friedman, The Erciyes Fragments is a version of the Book of Nod that has never been seen before by mortal eyes. The most sage of vampiric scholars provide their commentary for your enlightenment. Revealed now for the first time are the prophecies of Nod and of Gehenna!

55637.name: Jerusalem by Night
55637.description:
From the publisher:

The City of God
It sits at the crossroads of the world. Held by Islam, open to Christian pilgrims and longed for by the Children of Israel, Jerusalem is the magnet that draws three faiths to one place. It is here that East and West collide bloodily, where palmers from England and hashishin about their business can pass in the street. And it is here that Cainites gather, drawn by a power far greater than they can comprehend or fight.

Afflicted by the Curse of Caine
Enter Jerusalem by Night and learn its ways. Discover the ancient alliances and enmities that have outlasted kingdoms and Crusades. Meet the Cainites who have seen millennia from their perch atop Davids city, and pay them homage. But beware, for while everyone is drawn to Jerusalem, only one can possess it.

Back Cover:

The Holy City Beckons
They say that in 1099, when the Second Crusade took Jerusalem, the streets ran so deep with blood that a man on horseback would have his progress slowed by the flood. They say that the Cainites who followed the invaders went mad then, and that few who aided in the sack of the city were ever seen again. They also tell stories of ancient Cainites lurking in the Valley of Hinnom, where the lepers dwell, and of monstrous acts of faith and devotion, beneath the Temple Mount. They say many things about Jerusalem, for it is a place of wonder and faith, of blood and fear. And now its gates lie open. Enter, if you dare.

A Bloody Past, A Legacy of Faith
Jerusalem by Night is the complete guide to the Holy City in the Dark Medieval world. From the gates of the City to the Temple Mount, from David’s conquest to the uneasy truce between Saladin and Richard the Lion-Hearted, the whole city is here. Learn its secrets. Meet the Cainites who have dwelt here for centuries. Some have wandered, but always they return. For there is always, and always will be, Jerusalem.

Jerusalem by Night includes:

The history of the Holy City, from its prehistoric roots through the conquests, reconstructions and Crusades;
A complete roster of the vampiric denizens of Jerusalem, from the haughtiest Ventrue to the most humble Nosferatu;
A guide to the city's layout, a survival guide for religious Cainites and more!

55638.name: The Ashen Knight
55638.description:
From the publisher:

A Glimmer of Hope in a Darkened Soul...
Mightiest of Dark Medieval warriors, knights on horseback have cut a swath of crusade and war across Europe. Lords of men and slayer of infidels, they attract the childer of Caine like maggots to dead flesh. Some vampires seek out knights solely as pawns in their power games, but others look to Chivalry as a way to stave off the Beast.

And a Stream of Blood on a Drawn Blade?
Across Europe and Outremer, vampiric knights fight in midnight tournaments and shadow crusades. Knightly orders of Cainites pursue goals both blessed and unholy and seek to avoid the attention of Templer devil-hunters and other chivalrous threats.

From the back cover:

The Ashen Knight includes:

Details on knighthood and chivalry across Europe, including knightly orders such as the Templars and Hospitalers;
Complete information on vampiric knights;
The truth on the mysterious Order of the Biter Ashes;
Plentiful information on playing chivalrous women, both in and out of armor;
Expanded character creation rules and new Traits

55639.name: Right of Princes
55639.description:
Back Cover:

Claim Your Birthright

Whether by inheritance, force or divine ordinance, the land is yours to control and its inhabitants yours to command. You might rule over a vast forest, or your word may be law in a city. The resources of the place are yours and the people look to you for guidance and leadership. In the Dark Medieval, land is power. What will you do with yours?

Rule the Dark Medieval

Right of Princes is the primer on ruling and commanding a domain for all of the Dark Ages games, from a vampire's dark fief to a mage's arcane chantry to a werewolf or inquisitor's hunting grounds. Players will find rules and suggestions for developing their characters' homesteads both individually and as a group - as well as tips for defending them when a rival turns a jealous eye.

Right of Princes includes:

Information suitable for all four major characters - vampires, mages, inquisitors and werewolves - on building and keeping a demesne
Expansions on the 'pooled Background' rules introduced in Dark Ages Vampire
Four sample demesnes for use as inspiration or plot hooks

55640.name: Under the Black Cross
55640.description:
Back Cover:

War of the Damned

It is a time of conflict. The Ventrue Lord Jurgen and the Tzimisce Vladimir Rustovitch battle for domain in Hungary, while their agents spar across Europe, using intrigue and bloodshed in equal measure. In the Holy Land, the Fifth Crusade arrives in Acre, and the vampiric lords' agents come with it in pursuit of a fragment of the True Cross. Victory can come only at a terrible price.

Blood of the Innocent

Under the Black Cross is a complete chronicle for Vampire: The Dark Ages. Its three stories follow Ventrue efforts to use the Teutonic Knights to establish domain in the Tzimisce territories of Hungary, sending agents as far afield as the Holy Land in pursuit of allies and advantage.

Under the Black Cross includes:

A way to bring your Dark Ages game forward into the 1220s.
Details on the Teutonic Knights and on Acre, a city closed off from Cainite influence for centuries, now cast open.
The chance to put your players' coterie center stage for the continued transformation of the Dark Ages setting.

55641.name: Heia Safari
55641.description: Dexterity game in which the players use rubber bands to shoot chips onto a game board. The first shot is aimed at catching an animal (which succeeds when the chip stops on a line that is connected to an animal), if the second shot stops in the center field of the game board, the player can release all animals of one kind (from the other players). The first player to catch seven different animals is the winner.

55642.name: Bitter Crusade
55642.description:
Back Cover:

Warriors of Christ

Pope Innocent has called for a Fourth Crusade against the Saracen, and knights from across Europe gather to respond. Cainites and mortals alike taint the enterprise with their own ambitions. In Venice, Cainites gather to decide on the crusade's course, only to watch it spiral out of control and head toward Constantinople and its powerful masters. Blood calls to blood, and the flames of mortal hatred burn brightly.

Monsters of the Faith

Bitter Crusade is a chronicle detailing the Fourth Crusade, the latest Christian adventure toward the Holy Land. Over the course of three stories, set in Venice, Zara (on the Dalmation coast) and Constantinople itself, it shows how mortal and immortal agendas conspire to turn a holy war into a mockery and set Christian against Christian. In the fires that end it all, the Long Night itself comes to an end.

Bitter Crusade includes:

A way to bring your Dark Ages game forward from 1197 to 1204;
Details on Venice and Constantinople, updating previous material;
The chance to put your players' coterie center stage for the transformation of the Dark Ages setting.

55643.name: House of Tremere
55643.description:
Back Cover:

Throw Open the Gate of Ceoris

High in the Transylvanian Alps sits Ceoris, the home of Tremere and his Usurpers. From its battlements they plot against magi and Cainites alike, send their Gargoyle slaves against the Tzimisce and increase their power nightly. One of the most secret and protected places in Cainite world, Ceoris shelters Tremere himself as well as teh most powerful and ambitious of his clan.

And Tremble at the Secrets Revealed

House of Tremere is a complete handbook to Ceoris, the head chantry of Clan and House Tremere in Vampire: The Dark Ages. It includes a complete cast of character and a detailed guide to this massive fortress on the front lines of the war with the Tzimisce. Learn the secret agendas behind the Usurpers' plans, see the spawning pits of the twisted Gargoyles and play your part in the fate of all Cainites.

House of Tremere includes:

A room-by-room description of the entire chantry, complete with detailed floor-plans;
Details on other Tremere chantries across Europe;
New thaumaturgic rituals, potions and other foul creations of the Ursurper labs

55645.name: Jet-Set
55645.description: Players roll dice and walk around a large game board. On each square they land, they have to fulfill certain tasks. However, when they have to draw an event card, for example, they can choose to use it immediately or at any point later. To win, all cards must have been played. During the game, players also have to collect 15 objects (hotels, airlines etc.). And lastly, the winner needs to have at least 100 million dollars.

55646.name: Stormcrows Gather
55646.description:
Publisher blurb:

This adventure completes the Her Dark Majesty trilogy, following on from Beneath Dark Towen and Where the Fallen Jarls Sleep. Can you save The Land Of Song from the evil that threatens to overwhelm it.

An AD&D Adventure for Character Levels 5­ - 7

Module background text:

A brutal winter has fallen on the Land of Song. Weakened by incessant attacks throughout the autumn by humanoids and worse descending from the Trevärä Peaks, its hardy people now struggle against the unrelenting elements. An ancient enemy of the clans seeks to reassert her cold iron grip on the northern reaches. Sharp checks have been dealt against her and now the clans are holed up in their ancestral halls and strongholds. Waiting out the storms of ice and snow, they hope their meager stores will last.

55647.name: Gergovie
55647.description:
This game is a simulation of the assault on Gergovia, Caesar's failed attempt to wipe out the threat of a large Gallic uprising by isolating and defeating a gathering of several Gallic contingents, under Vercingetorix.

66 counters
One hex = 180 meters
10 pages rules book (+scenarios and historical background)

55648.name: Trident Rock
55648.description:
Publisher blurb:

Can you unravel the mysteries of the island of Trident Rock?
A tournament adventure for levels 5-7.

55649.name: Lago Peipus 1242
55649.description:
Number 7 of the Italian magazine Giocarea.
Simulation of the battle of Lake Peipus, 1242 AD between the Russian leader Alexandre Nevskii and the Teutonic knights backed by the holy Roman Empire.
One map, 143 pieces
Scale:
one hex = 50 meters
one infantry unit = 200 men
one cavalry unit = 100 knights

55650.name: RolaGolf
55650.description:
RolaGolf is a game for all the family, young and not so young, golfer or non-golfer, and can be played in a variety of ways:

1. Stroke-Play
2. Match-Play
3. Match-Play Foursomes
4. Match-Play Greensomes
5. Bogey Matches
6. Stableford

The dice (cubes) must be thrown individually in strict sequence: RED (Drive) YELLOW (2nd shot) BLUE (3rd shot) BLACK (4th shot) GREEN (putts); unless the result of the throw indicates otherwise.

The 6 variants have differnt goals to reach. In most forms the player have to reach the most holes in an agreed number of strockes, or to count how many strockes they need for an agreed number of holes.

The matches can be played in pairs what will made a max. 12 of player.

rpg: The Nighttime Animals Save the World
55651.name: The Nighttime Animals Save the World
55651.description:
From the original document:

You play while you stroll of a summer's evening. The in-game events happen in the real-world setting. Like you can say "see that place in the fence back there where the lilac bushes are? There are 2 cats back there, whispering, and they give you a dirty look." You can say "I jump up onto the roof, see right there, and then onto the dormer, and can I make it onto the roof next door?" Like that.

The PCs are nighttime animals, specifically raccoons, rabbits, skunks and opossums. All of 'em can run and jump and hide and see in the dark and smell smells and stuff. Raccoons also have opposable thumbs, skunks have stink power, opossums can dangle by their tails, and rabbits can run fast and jump real high.

They save the world! Something bad's going on, like there's a sorcerous hurricane devastating the neighborhood, or somebody's making all the dogs mean instead of just friendly, curious and kinda dumb, or the cats are doing their thing about who's king of the cats and it's turning ugly and spilling over into inter-species violence. Conveniently enough, whoever's behind it is headquartered at the destination of your stroll. (Many is the world-threatening plot hatched in and around our local popcycle store or our favorite video rental place!) Only the nighttime animal PCs realize just how serious it is, and if they don't solve it, it'll be bad for everybody.

55653.name: The Battle For Gib Rus
55653.description:
An AD&D Tournament Adventure Module for 6 characters of 5th to 7th level.

Publisher blurb:

The forces of darkness threaten the natural splendour of Gib Rus. Do you have what it takes to save this idyllic corner of the world?

An additional pack of supplementary information is also available for download.

55654.name: Book Of Mormon Football
55654.description: After teaching a Book of Mormon lesson, divide the group (or family) into two teams. Place both footballs on the 50 yard line (one above the large football in the center of the board and one below). Each team takes a turn picking a question from the "Question" sack. If they answer it correctly, they then pick a yardage amount from the "Yards" sack. They move their football the indicated amount. Continue taking turns until one team reaches the goal line. Then the team can pick an additional card from the "Extra Point" sack. On a chalk board or piece of paper, keep score. Each team receives 6 points for each goal and the amount of extra points they pick from the "Extra Point" sack. When all the questions have been answered (or time is up), the winners are determined by their score.

55655.name: Episode Number 05: The Chicago Caper
55655.description:
From the Front of the Box:

A Dinner Party Game for Eight
So Much Fun, It's Almost Criminal!

From the Back of the Box:

You have received an invitation to S. P. Keasy's place, a private club near the headquarters of notorious gangster "Hal" Coppone. Assume the role of one of these eight worldly characters. Imagine your home is a 1920s speakeasy in old Chicago, as you and your dinner guests enjoy hours of suspense and intrigue. All you need is a sense of humor and a light-hearted approach towards deceit, larceny, sex and murder. How To Host A Murder is so much fun, it's almost criminal!

MOLLY M. AWBSTERR - A society dame from New York, Molly came to Chicago for the action. Molly is a flapper from the top of the feather in her hat to the tip of her satin shoes and maintains an apartment on the top floor of Chicago's most exclusive apartment hotel.

ERNIE ("BET A MILLION") G. AMBLER - Early in the decade, Ernie parlayed a small stake into a stock exchange fortune. Now Chicago’s most colorful millionaire gambler, he still actively plays the stock market, but his favorite game is poker. Ernie is flamboyant, outspoken, and always ostentatiously dressed.

"SILKY" M. ADAM - Silky is a shady lady who owns and operates The Everlay Club, Chicago’s most prominent private establishment. The wealthiest and most influential citizens of Chicago are members, and despite their busy schedules, they often stop in for an hour or two to pass the time in the elegant atmosphere.

EDDIE ("SOCKS") R. GYLE - Smooth, fashionable and clever, Eddie is an avid golfer and spends most afternoons at the Lake View Country Club dressed elegantly in plus fours and argyle socks. In the evenings he can be found at his exclusive gaming house in downtown Chicago, known simply as Green Tables, where the affluent and trendy citizens of Chicago come to gamble.

MALISSA F. ORRTHOT ("SCOOP") - As a young reporter for the city’s leading paper, The Chicago Trumpet, Scoop quickly made a name for herself on the crime beat and later covering the political scene. Her considerable beauty and lively charm have undoubtedly helped further her career, and she enjoys a broad circle of influential and powerful friends on both sides of the law

S. TREIGHTON HARROW - U.S. District Attorney and chief opponent of the criminal element in Chicago, Harrow is single-handedly responsible for bringing to justice several of crime’s most despicable practitioners. Amidst the corruption and complacency that characterize Chicago law enforcement, Harrow stands out as a shining example.

ANNA MARIA CARLOTTA SASSINE ("TORCHY") - Currently the featured singer at Green Tables, Torchy has also appeared in many exclusive night clubs in Chicago. Her exuberant style and traditional renditions of "torch songs" have earned this blues singer the nickname "Torchy". Smoldering beauty and a sultry voice contribute to Torchy’s appeal.

BILLY ("THE KID") THROWER - Star pitcher for the Chicago Stock Kings major league baseball team, Billy was born to play baseball. He won 22 games for the team last season, and currently holds the league strikeout record. Off the field, Billy is as fun-loving, hard-drinking, warm-hearted, lustful, brawling and hell-raising as a baseball player can be.

CONTENTS INCLUDE:


a cassette tape revealing details of the murder
a host guide with instructions
a sheet of secret clues
8 guest invitations and envelopes
8 nametags
8 player manuals containing secret information
a diagram of the crime scene
optional dinner and costume suggestions for the truly adventurous

55656.name: Against the Shadow
55656.description:
From the back of the book:

The orcs swarm like a plague over half the continent. Mage-hunting legates and their demonic pets track down the last vestiges of magic in the land. The dark god Izrador broods and watches the world through his black mirrors. The forces are overwhelming, your enemies are dark and twisted, and you will surely perish if you resist.

But you fight.

You are the northborn ancestral bladebearer. You are the elven spellsoul. You are the pureblood Sarcosan knight. You are the fellhunting wogren rider. Your magic is rare but ancient, your allies few but stalwart.

AGAINST THE SHADOW is a player's companion and DM resource for the dark and epic campaign setting MIDNIGHT. Desperate fighters against the shadow will find new heroic paths, prestige classes, feats, spells, and weapons to help them survive. New herbalism rules create a non-magic party support option specifically tailored for the MIDNIGHT campaign. Finally, even DMs will find valuable material in new power nexuses and covenant items.

The dark lord Izrador hasn't won yet. These are bleak times, but there are still those who pit themselves AGAINST THE SHADOW.

55657.name: SqueakQuest
55657.description:
From the introduction:

Welcome to SqueakQuest, a slightly odd game about squeak toys on an epic quest across a mystical (yet oddly familiar) landscape. There have been a number of games that have utilized toys as playing pieces in the past. Where SqueakQuest differs is that it toes a slightly darker, more serious line than those other games. You’re a grown-up who plays with toys; your toys should have more grown-up adventures. Which is not to say that this is some dreary, “mature”, angst-ridden exercise in nihilism. They’re still toys after all and there’s a great deal of humor to be found herein. What’s important is that despite the humor, it’s all very deadly serious to your toy.

Remember playing with toys as a kid? You may not have had the deepest plots or most intricate storylines, but whatever your toy did, it mattered. Whether it was GI Joe wiping out Cobra or Barbie going out on a date, or pirate adventures with your rubber duckie, the point is that you were really identifying with the toy and the things it was doing. Your imagination made the stories come to life and they were just as important as anything that you were doing on the playground.

We’re going to try and use this game to recapture some of that “play intensity” and along the way, don’t be surprised if some rather odd, but rewarding storytelling comes out of it.

55658.name: Hit the Dirt: WWII scenarios for Crossfire
55658.description:
21 scenarios (from 1941 to 1945) to use with the CROSSFIRE rules, or with any other set of rules for WWII miniatures at squad level.

It includes also new special rules for night fighting, new terrain types, bogging down of vehicles, indirect fire on vehicles, direct fire mortars and the "timing clock" (a mechanic to vary the intensity and pace of a scenario).

55659.name: Crown of Shadow
55659.description:
From the back of the book:

No one race or culture has the might to stand against Izrador and his foul legates. The dwarves are valiant, but caged in their mountains. The elves are skilled, but have neither the numbers nor the resources to fight off the orc hordes forever. Yet there are some few who would join their knowledge and skills, the better to fight the Shadow that has fallen over both peoples.

And those few are hunted.

CROWN OF SHADOW is a desperate quest across Eredane, ranging from the depths of the Kaladrun Mountains, across the grim expanse of the occupied plains of Erenland, through the secretive underground of the Eren River, and finally into the heart of the Whispering Wood itself. The players, inexperienced rebels in the fight against Izrador and the Night Kings, become the unintended recipients of a valuable prize, the unwilling charges of a deadly quest. The forces of the Shadow have uncovered a prize of their own, however, and have given it to one of their most devious champions. The party must elude this tireless pursuer and reach sanctuary a continent away, lest they fall prey to the CROWN OF SHADOW.

An adventure for 4 to 6 characters that takes them from 1st to 5th level.

boardgamehonor: 2010 Golden Geek Best Board Game Expansion Nominee
55660.description:
Expansion for Dixit. 84 new cards with paintings that can be used on their own (but then you need some kind of voting tokens and paper and pencil to take notes of the scoring) or with those from the base game (or with Dixit: Journey or Dixit Odyssey).

The game does not contain scoring board and tokens, but it will be packed in a smaller box in which it is much easier to take it on a trip. This game could theoretically be played as it is, but the components needed to play are contained in the base-game.

As in Dixit, each round, one player takes on the role of Storyteller who chooses one card from his hand, tells, sings or does something that in his opinion is associated with the played card. Other players choose their own cards. Then cards are shuffled and revealed, and players vote which card was played by Storyteller, and score points according to their guesses.

Player who has the most points wins the game.
boardgameversion: Libellud multilingual first edition 2010 with 8 languages
55660.name: Dixit Quest

55661.name: Munchkins
55661.description:
Subtitle: Violence, Idiocy, and the Great Glowy Box

Publisher's description:

Nearly every human culture has legends of something like the Faerie -- spirits which live alongside mankind as neither demon nor angel. Often beautiful, always dangerous, these creatures may be placated and even benevolent towards mankind. With these creatures of make-believe, we have captured perhaps the most primal parts of our own souls.

But forget all that. This is a game about being stupid, television-obsessed, and casually violent.

Oh, and lest you think that it's not roleplaying at all, being 2" tall.

55662.name: Sabotagem
55662.description:
Cunning and cold-blooded to be the best secret agent!
During a meeting that took place in a big city with the most powerful world leaders, a suitcase containing invaluable state secrets has been stolen. The best secret agents were summoned to the task of retrieving the information contained in this bag and the winner will receive one million dollar reward, besides knowing the oldest secrets of the mankind. Uncover your opponents and abuse the nerve to not be discovered and enter into history as the best secret agent of all time"(Translated from the game box)
Each player represents a secret agent, but there may be ghosts agents (additional pawns). On his turn, the player moves any agents, distributing the total movement points obtained among the agents he wants to move. When one or more pawns stop at the building where the suitcase is, all players score: the pawn which is the suitcase’s building receives 5 points and the other pawns receive points corresponding to the buildings where they are at this moment. At the beginning of the game, each player only knows its own identity. Thus, the game has two objectives: to win more points by moving the pawns (the game ends when someone reaches 42 points) and earn additional points, by discovering the identity of other agents (this is done, once someone reaches 32 points, placing numbered chips into the slots of the forecasts bases).

55663.name: Rebel Moon Defense
55663.description:
Rebel Moon Defense is a fast-playing game for two, inspired by the Tower Defense genre.

The imperials have discovered the last rebel outpost on a moon colony surrounded by an asteroid belt, and launched a devastating Chaos Bomb to destroy it. The bomb appears at a nearby star gate and heads straight for the base, but the rebels have had time to place automated weapons and booby traps on some of the asteroids.

Will the Chaos Bomb reach the moon and annihilate the rebels? Or can they destroy it and evacuate their base?

55664.name: Polygo
55664.description:
55 playing cards of irregular four-sided shape, and each card can have 0, 1, 2, 3 or 4 different colour segments, plus a letter of the alphabet.
All games proposed use the same 6 simple matching rules to decide which moves are legal or not.

You can play with them all traditional card games, but the rulebook offers also 11 new and very different games to play:

1) Pentago (for 2-4 players)
By matching your cards by colour with that on the table, you must play all your cards or block your opponents from playing.

2) Polygo Word (for 2-6 players)
The object is to score as many points as possible by forming a single dictionary word of 2 or more letters, using always at least 1 letter from a previous word.

3) Polygo Challenge 2001
A solo game, where you must build a 7x7 block of cards, each matching by colour segment with at least another near card.

4) Astack (for 2-4 players)
Stacking cards you must play all your cards first, or force your opponent to pick more cards.

5) Solo 1
A solitaire game: object is to transfer all cards from the deck to three colums, and then to a final play pile.

6) Solo 2
Beat your own score by drawing cards and playing them on the table only if you can find at least one match with the previously placed cards.

7) Polywords (for 2-5 players)
By placing cards in a crossword style you must form any to or more letter dictionary words.

8) 5-Up (for 2-6 players)
A Pentago variant, where cards must by played inside a block a 5x5 cards.

9) Polygo Whist (for 2-8 players)
Win most Tricks and score as high as possible by playing every hand the highest ranking Trump or the highest leading Suit.

10) Polygo Rummy (for 2-6 players)
Be the first to meld all your cards of the same Suit with at least one segment of the same colour.

11) Polygo Shape Puzzles (for 1-8 players)
Try to beat your score or of your opponents by placing cards to form one of five possible shapes with matching cards.

55665.name: Die Bettler von Grangor
55665.description:
Translated from the back of the box:

"'The Beggars of Grangor'
Grangor, one of the oldest and most beautiful cities of Aventuria, is famous picturesque architecture and big trading houses who secure prosperity and peace. Suddenly though one family of patricians after the other is hit by uncanny strokes of fate. Who can end this terror before chaos reigns the city...?
This adventure contains among other things a double sided map and detailed information of the city."

55667.name: Die Kanäle von Grangor
55667.description:
Translated from the back of the box:

"'The Channels of Grangor'
Only to view Aventurians it is granted to meet a goddess incarnate, and facing the immortals even a grand hero is only a puny creature! Yet your heroes can tip the scales in a battle of the gods that threatens to destroy the city of Grangor!"

55668.name: Dragon (Issue 367 - Sep 2008)
rpgissuearticle: Ampersand - Fun with Pigs and Other Stories
Confessions of a Full-Time Wizard - Master Mind
Design & Development - The Evoluton of Magic Items
Expeditionary Dispatches - Lost Village of Janus Gull
RPGA Report - Organizing Your First Forgotten Realms Game

55669.name: Das Grauen von Ranak
55669.description:
User summary:

'The Terror of Ranak'
Investigating the whereabouts of some missing fisherman, the heroes discover that a lonely monastery dedicated to Efferd, god of the sea, has been taken over by strange mermen from a volcanic island in the uncharted south seas. The heroes have to rescue the improsoned priests and local fishermen before they are sacrificed to a giant calamary the mermen worship as a god.
Part 1 of 4 of the Southern Seas Trilogy.

boardgamehonor: 2010 Boardgames Australia Awards Best International Game Nominee
2010 Golden Geek Best Strategy Board Game Nominee
2010 Golden Geek Most Innovative Board Game Nominee
2010 International Gamers Awards - General Strategy; Multi-player Nominee
2010 JoTa Best Family Board Game Nominee
55670.description:
At the end of the 17th century, Macao – the mysterious port city on the southern coast of China – is a Portuguese trading post in the Far East. The players take on the role of energetic and daring adventurers. Many exciting tasks and challenges await the players, whether they are a captain, governor, craftsman, or scholar. Those who chose the wisest course of action and have the best overall strategy will earn the most prestige at the end.

Macao lasts twelve rounds, and in each round players select one new card from a display specific to that round, two of which were revealed at the start of the game and others that were revealed only at the start of the round. The deck of 96 cards includes all sorts of special abilities, with the more powerful actions costing more resources to put into play.

One player rolls six different-colored dice, then each player selects two of those dice (possibly the same ones chosen by opponents), then places cubes equal to the number and color of the two dice on a personalized "ship's wheel." For example, if a player chooses the blue die that shows a 5, he places five blue cubes on the ship's wheel position five spots away from the current round. (A player can never claim more cubes than the number of remaining rounds).

Players rotate their ship's wheels each round, then use the cubes available to them in that round to perform various actions: activating cards selected in that round or earlier rounds, buying city quarters and collecting the goods located there, moving that player's ship around Europe to deliver those goods, acquiring gold coins, taking special actions with card previously activated, and advancing on a turn order track.

Players score points by delivering goods, paying gold coins, using the powers on their cards, and building in Macao. Whoever has the most points at the end of twelve rounds wins.

Macao is number 13 in the alea big box series, with an estimated difficulty on the alea scale of 6/10.
55670.name: Macao
boardgamepodcastepisode: BGWS 067 – Dicing for Resources
Cult of the New Board Game Podcast Episode 010 – Our 2016 Wishlist
Episode 21: Steam Works And Duel Lists
Episode 29: Enigma and Macao
Episode 72 March Craziness Dice Game Style Part 1
Episode 73 March Craziness Dice Game Style Part 2
Episode 83-- Live from GEN CON Part 2-- from the show floor
Exploring Games, Episode 3: Spotlight on Blogs, Prototypes, and the Freaking Jones Theory
Garrett's Games 472 - Macao, Luna, and Pillars of the Earth : Builders Duel
Heavy Cardboard Episode 36 – Neue Heimat
Mechanics in a Name
Spiele-Podcast Nr. 68: Macao (alea / Ravensburger)
The Spiel #100 - Roll, Turn, Flip

55671.name: Die Fahrt der Korisande
55671.description:
Translated from the back of the box:

"'The Voyage of the Korisande'
In the deep south of Aventuria already the 'Terror of Ranak' took place. Here - and even further south - the events of this story unfold as well. Effectively a sequel to the tale of Ranak, the heroes sign onto the Korisande, a seaworthy coast ship with a motley crew. After a while, thunderstorms dampen the crews mood; and to make matters worse, the expedition ends - for now - being stranded on a volcanic island. The heroes' fate seems to be sealed."
Part 2 of 4 of the Southern Seas Trilogy.

55672.name: Domin-Up
55672.description:
"The domino game you build as you play."

This unique set of interlocking stackable dominoes includes a wooden board, 28 wooden dominoes, and a cloth storage bag. Player build up from the board using conventional domino strategy as the stack branches out when a double is played.

Designed for ages 3 and older with safe, non-toxic wooden parts.

Eureka Studios Item #1902

55673.name: Army Ants (1st Edition)
55673.description:
Cover title: Michael T. Desing’s Army Ants The Role-Playing Game, 3rd Edition

In the tiny world of insects, every back yard is a nation at war; every field is an unexplored frontier. In a place where beehives are impregnable fortresses and anthills are thriving cities, danger and adventure lurk atop every tree, under every rock, and behind every plant. This is the world of BUGS, the Basic Universal Game System, and the world of Michael T. Desing’s Army Ants. Welcome to the backyard.

BUGS, the Basic Universal Game System is based on the results of six-sided dice rolls. The more capable a character is in a particular ability, the more dice he or she may roll or the more points he or she receives in bonuses, and the greater the likelihood of success, sometimes of varying degrees.

55674.name: Minions of the Shadow
55674.description:
From the back of the book:

In the Aruun Jungle, children turn against their parents and the plants and bodiless spirits haunt ancient ruins.

In the havens of the Miransil and the clanholds of the dwarves, not all are as they seem.

In the barren Northlands, the earth and sky alike hunger for human blood.

And in the strongholds of the Shadow, new and terrible foes are bred from foul rituals and dark magics.

Welcome to Eredane, a land under Shadow. The creatures herein fill many roles, from the natural animals of Eredane’s ecosystem to the most vicious hunters under Izrador’s command. They range from minor annoyances and tricksters to powerful beings that even the Night Kings fear. Also included are stat blocks and backgrounds for several of Izrador’s most notorious servants: Grial the Fey Killer, Zebrim the Slayer, Darshod of the Dead Mother Tribe, and more. Whether you need more creatures to pit against your heroes on Aryth, or you want to bring the taste of MIDNIGHT to another campaign, the MINIONS OF THE SHADOW are ready to serve.

55675.name: That Old Black Magic
55675.description:
On the cover: A fantasy noir setting for Mean Streets, requires the use of Mean Streets

From the introduction:

That Old Black Magic is a freebie supplement for Deep7's role-playing game of classic film noir Mean Streets. Veering slightly to the left of the game's default 1943 setting, Black Magic presents an alternate setting for the game, incorporating sorcery against the backdrop of 1940s Hollywood. It's a world where gangsters in expensive suits are master sorcerers, spirits get the third degree from cops, zombies come six to a crate just like bon-bons, and your landlady is a licensed witch.

Black Magic gets its influence from films such as Cast a Deadly Spell, Witch Hunt and other role-playing games, specifically West End Games' Bloodshadows. Don't take the setting too seriously, though, as it was written tongue-in-cheek and meant for a little light-hearted change of pace, interjecting a bit of Hollywood magic quite literally.

rpgitemversion: La Cité de l'Ombre PDF version
55676.name: City of Shadow
55676.description:
From the back of the book:

As the Third Age came to a bloody close, one of the first victims of the brutal march of the Shadow's armies across Eredane was the city of Highwall. Since the First Age, the city and its Scholar's Academy stood as a beacon of hope and enlightenment in a darkening world. That shining beacon was shattered seemingly overnight as the fury of the Shadow in the North descended on the world.

Now, a hundred years later, the city of Highwall lies in ruin. At the center of this desolation rises Theros Obsidia, a black tower of impossible size that was magicked from the earth and stone like a splinter drawn from flesh. This is the locus of Izrador's power in Eredane and the fortress of his legates, the Order of Shadow. Huddled around the tower are the camps and garrisons of the Shadow's hordes, along with the ruins and hovels of the city's survivors. Highwall has become a place of death and darkness, and only the bravest, most foolhardy, or most desperate heroes dare to intrude into the heart of Shadow.

The fourth supplement for the award-winning MIDNIGHT campaign setting, City of Shadow offers detailed information on the ruined and occupied city of Highwall, a level-by-level description of Theros Obsidia complete with beautiful maps and illustrations, and in-depth information on the Order of Shadow.

55677.name: Kilohurtz
55677.description:
Using “Nano-Bots” as computer programming aids, you are trying to create circuit pathways to allow your nano-bots to complete their assigned programs before your opponents do.

But you’ll have to watch out for other players nano-bots that are trying to throw you off the board into a heat sink, or giving you advanced programing codes you don’t need. The board has a unique relay system that flips over every time a nano-bot crosses over one, possibly changing your path to victory!

55678.name: Broadsword
55678.description:
Publisher's description:

The 1PG line gets the sword & sorcery treatment with this beer & pretzels fantasy game from Jeff Mejia and James Stubbs. Following the tropes of cheesy barbarian movies of the 1970s and 1980s, Broadsword is the most burly and robust 1PG yet! Powered by Todd Downing's 1PG system, this game is so simple you can play it with a beer buzz, a head wound*, or BOTH!

As always, the 1PG is easy to learn, quick to play and fully disposable.

* Deep7 in no way endorses playing RPGs with a head wound - please seek medical assistance.

boardgamehonor: 2010 Origins Awards Best Historical Board Game Nominee
55679.description:
Panzer General: Allied Assault is a quick playing game of WWII tactical / operational combat using a unique blend of cards and a board game. The game takes place during the last phase of World War II, from 1944 to 1945. The dramatic events of D-Day finally gave the Allies a foothold on Fortress Europe, allowing them to push the Germans back to Berlin.

Recreate actual battles such as Utah Beach, Operation Market Garden, and the infamous Battle of the Bulge in the hopes of turning back the German tide. Build, customize and fight with your personalized deck of 60 cards.

Over 12 solo and two-player scenarios depicting combat situations between the German and American forces in such battles as D-Day, Bulge, Market-Garden, Metz, and many others.

Based on the Xbox LIVE® Arcade game published by UBISOFT.

Panzer General: Russian Assault is a sequel to Allied Assault and is available now.

Microbadges
Panzer General Allied Assault Fan
Panzer General Allied Assault Fan
55679.name: Panzer General: Allied Assault
boardgamepodcastepisode: The Little Metal Dog Show - Episode 6

55680.name: Deep Space Disaster
55680.description:
Automated alert systems have awakened the crew from Cryo-sleep. But why?

Deep Space Disaster is the game of Deep Space... and Disasters!

Each player takes on the role of a crew member of the perpetually troubled starship Rabidus Traba. Players move about and explore by laying cards representing different areas of the ship, thus forming the game board. As more areas are revealed and useful items are accumulated, things start going wrong, and the closer the ship comes to disaster!

The players don't know when it will happen or even what the disaster may be until it strikes. The disaster scenario will then lay out how the crew must work together to overcome and survive. That is unless the secret traitors are able to thwart them!

Deep Space Disaster is a print-and-play game developed as part of a BGG competition. Further development and expansions are planned.

55681.name: Battlelords of the Twenty-Third Century (4th Edition)
rpg: Battlelords of the Twenty-Third Century (3rd & 4th Editions)
55681.description:
" "Battlelords of the Twenty-Third Century is a paper and pencil science fiction role-playing game designed by Lawrence R. Sims and first published in 1990. The game's tagline is Roleplaying in a dangerous future. The Battlelords of the Twenty-Third Century license was later sold by Optimus Design Systems (ODS) to SSDC, Inc. in September 1999.

Battlelords of the Twenty-Third Century is set in the year 2279. The territory of the Galactic Alliance, spanning several galaxies, is the primary setting for the game. The Galactic Alliance is made up of twelve races (including Humans), and is run behind the scenes by huge mega-corporations seeking to exploit the farthest reaches of space.

Player characters usually assume the role of Battlelords, mercenaries employed by the corporations to further their business by any means, legal or otherwise. They face various challenges, including rival mercenaries, Rebels, hostile alien lifeforms on unexplored worlds, and the alien race known as the Arachnids."

From the publisher "Battlelords of the Twenty-Third Century is a deep space roleplaying system that focuses on the Alliance of 27 alien races who desperately seek to ward off the threat of internal destruction while simultaneously exploring the vast uncharted regions of space. For the Battlelord, loyalty is to the company, yet corporate devotion never exceeds allegiance to your friends. The mercenary team embodies everything that is valued in society: esprit de corps, honor, and valor. At least that is what the papers say! Your job is a simple one, do anything and everything to stay alive. The company gets all the press. You get to pick up a paycheck. No one cares about methods, but in the 23rd century, everybody needs a hero! It is a battlefield without boundaries, a cemetery without grounds. It is a land whose beauty is shrouded in mystery and danger. Space offers up its treasures only to those brave enough to challenge themselves. And this is Battlelords Country! "."

55682.name: Dharma Book: Bone Flowers
55682.description:
From the publisher:

Hear the Song of the Shadow
They know the secrets of the Underworld. The lands of the living hold no mysteries for them, nor do the realms of the Yama Kings. They are the Bone Flowers, and they know everything about you, too. But now you have the chance to learn everything about them.

Learn the Secrets of Darkness
Dharma Book: Bone Flowers is the second Dharma Book for Kindred of the East. It contains all of the hidden knowledge of the Song of the Shadow, from rituals and rites to secret agendas regarding the other dharmas. Once you have glanced inside, you'll never listen to the Song of the Shadow the same way again.

55683.description:
Action Castle is the first Parsely game.

[From the Game]

Parsely games are based on the old text adventure parsers from the 1980s. In this version, the computer is replaced by a person and the software is replaced by a map and an outline of the adventure to be played.

--

> WELCOME TO... ACTION CASTLE!


Cottage

> You are standing in a small cottage. There is a fishing pole here.
Exits are: Out
rpgpodcastepisode: Episode 47 Action Castle: You are in a cottage
55683.name: Action Castle
rpghonor: 2009 Indie RPG Awards - Best Support - Runner Up
2009 Indie RPG Awards - Most Innovative Game - Runner Up

55684.name: Escape from Tentacle City
rpghonor: 2009 Indie RPG Awards - Game of the Year - Runner Up
55684.description:
[From the back cover]
It’s overrun with giant tentacles bent on destruction! In this game of survival horror and dark comedy, you’ll take on the role of an unlikely hero, scraped off the bottom of society.

Create and play a host of survivors!
See the sights and sounds of historic Tentacle City!
Boldly sacrifice yourself to save your loved ones... or throw your grandma to the tentacles so you can save your own skin!
Loot whatever’s hand to fight against the tentacle menace... kitchen knives, chainsaws, squirt guns full of lighter fluid... whatever you can get your hands on.
Pimp Out your items to make them extra effective!
Pimped Out chainsaws, Pimped Out grandmas... these are your tools for survival.
Stare deep into the abyss.

55685.name: Gods
55685.description:
From the back of the book:

This is a Guide to the Heavens
This sourcebook contains the gods of dark elves, orcs, minotaurs, trolls, and even monstrous aberrations that have no religion. 16 different races are detailed within, providing DMs and players with information and rules about the divinity of their adversaries. Each chapter details a separate race, with enough information to fuel an entire campaign or just a few evenings of gaming.
The secrets of divinity are at hand.

The Righteous Shall Prevail
16 races
25 gods
19 prestige classes
34 domains
30 spells
16 temple maps
Over 60 magic items
25 relics
Complete backgrounds on over a dozen religions
Complete NPC priests each race for [sic]

55686.name: Double Series
55686.description:
From box cover:
Double Series. The challenging and exciting game for the whole family.
Object of the game:
To be the first player or the first team to score 2 series of 5 chips of the same color, either vertically, horizontally, or diagonally. Play is fast moving and easy to learn.

55687.name: School of Illusion
55687.description:
From the back of the book:
Alter your reality.
Kicking off a new series of books from Fantasy Flight Games, School of Illusion contains everthing you need to make illusion magic a key component of your game.
Featuring more than 60 new spells including the mind-twisting might of apocalypse, School of Illusion brings the concept of diving domains to arcane spellcasters in the form of "disciplines." Illusionists can now master invisibility, terror, true illution, and six other disciplines on their path to ultimate power. Best of all, the visual guide to illusions shows at a glance which senses a spell affects.
This book also contains 9 new prestige classes and a new core class - the devoted illusionist. In addition, it contains dozens of new items - both magical and mundune [sic] - to delight players. Whether you're customizing your very own illusionist's robe or wielding the awesome might of the staff of the illusionist, you'll never look at illusion magic the same way again.

55688.name: Battlelords of the Twenty-Third Century (5th Edition)
rpg: Battlelords of the Twenty-Third Century (5th & 6th Editions)
55688.description:
" "Battlelords of the Twenty-Third Century is a paper and pencil science fiction role-playing game designed by Lawrence R. Sims and first published in 1990. The game's tagline is Roleplaying in a dangerous future. The Battlelords of the Twenty-Third Century license was later sold by Optimus Design Systems (ODS) to SSDC, Inc. in September 1999.

Battlelords of the Twenty-Third Century is set in the year 2279. The territory of the Galactic Alliance, spanning several galaxies, is the primary setting for the game. The Galactic Alliance is made up of twelve races (including Humans), and is run behind the scenes by huge mega-corporations seeking to exploit the farthest reaches of space.

Player characters usually assume the role of Battlelords, mercenaries employed by the corporations to further their business by any means, legal or otherwise. They face various challenges, including rival mercenaries, Rebels, hostile alien lifeforms on unexplored worlds, and the alien race known as the Arachnids."

From the publisher "Battlelords of the Twenty-Third Century is a deep space roleplaying system that focuses on the Alliance of 27 alien races who desperately seek to ward off the threat of internal destruction while simultaneously exploring the vast uncharted regions of space. For the Battlelord, loyalty is to the company, yet corporate devotion never exceeds allegiance to your friends. The mercenary team embodies everything that is valued in society: esprit de corps, honor, and valor. At least that is what the papers say! Your job is a simple one, do anything and everything to stay alive. The company gets all the press. You get to pick up a paycheck. No one cares about methods, but in the 23rd century, everybody needs a hero! It is a battlefield without boundaries, a cemetery without grounds. It is a land whose beauty is shrouded in mystery and danger. Space offers up its treasures only to those brave enough to challenge themselves. And this is Battlelords Country! "."

55689.name: Hand of Shadow
55689.description:
From the back of the book:

Embrace the darkness of MIDNIGHT with this supplement for the award-winning campaign world. MIDNIGHT usually puts the players in the role of desperate freedom fighters waging war against overwhelming forces of evil. Hand of Shadow at last gives them the power to become that which their characters have hated and feared for so long...minions of the dark god!

Whether they play devoted legates, barbaric orcs, corrupted channelers, or clever collaborators, this book allows players to turn the usual MIDNIGHT campaign on its head, and to explore whether even the most evil of foes have a chance at redemption.


New backgrounds, racial rules, and roleplaying suggestions for evil PCs.
Prestige classes and advantages that are only available to servants of the Shadow.
Plot hooks and campaign progressions designed specifically for evil parties in MIDNIGHT; will the characters follow the path of evil, turn toward redemption, or choose their own way between the two?

boardgamehonor: 2015 Golden Geek Best Board Game Artwork/Presentation Nominee
2015 Golden Geek Best Solo Board Game Nominee
2015 Golden Geek Best Thematic Board Game Nominee
2015 Golden Geek Board Game of the Year Nominee

55690.description:
Kingdom Death: Monster is a fully cooperative tabletop hobby game experience. Set in a unique nightmarish world devoid of most natural resources, you control a settlement at the dawn of its existence. Fight monsters, craft weapons and gear, and develop your settlement to ensure your survival from generation to generation.

Campaign System
Embark alone or with up to 3 friends (5 with game variant) on a 5-30-lantern-year campaign, with each year consisting of a cycle of hunt, showdown, and settlement phases. The settlement phase is an intricate civilization building game in which you spend very limited resources to build buildings, research new technologies, train your warriors, and set up your strategy for survival. During the hunt, you'll encounter a series of stories in a "choose your own adventure" style journey through various events and encounters. Finally, when you meet the monster you're pursuing, you'll engage it in an a massive arena-style battle where only one party is going to survive. If your party lives, you'll be able to bring the spoils back home to use in expanding your settlement.

Monster AI System
Each of the 7 monsters included are controlled by their own pair of decks that scale to 3 levels of difficulty (except for the final encounter, which has only 1 level and it's HARD!). Every encounter, even with the same monster, is highly variable and no two showdowns will resolve the same way. Players will have to plan their gear and keep their minds sharp to prevail.

Gear System
In Kingdom Death: Monster, survivors will craft gear from resources earned from defeating monsters or found on their hunt. Each survivor has a 3x3 gear grid. Selection and arrangement of your gear cards is critical, as many provided bonuses and activate special rules when aligned correctly.

Story Event System
40+ Story Events plus over 100 hunt encounters will shape and guide your campaign. Story Events detail important evolutions in your civilization, introduce new monsters, and provide rich detail for your campaign. Some will trigger automatically as you progress through the campaign, but most will be entirely based on choices players make.

Story Events cover everything from setting up and fighting a monster to key events that happen within the overall story. Some are triggered directly from the timeline and others from choices you make in game.

55693.name: DragonQuest Third Edition
55693.description:
From the back of the book:

The Award-Winning Fantasy Role-Playing System

The most powerful and comprehensive fantasy role-playing system is now even easier and more fun in the thoroughly revised third edition. New Colleges of Magic (including Shaping and Rune Magics) have replaced outdated material and the unique experience point system has been carefully enhanced to make your characters capable of dynamic growth. Now presented in this one volume, the DRAGONQUEST system in once more available role-players everywhere. You actually need nothing more than this book and two decimal dice to play complete and enjoyable.

User Notes:
TSR bought SPI (original produces of DQ) and the DragonQuest line fell by the wayside. DragonQuest Third Edition, appears to have been a thinly supported effort to bring DragonQuest back. (There appear to be no official 3rd Edition supplements.)

The addition of the Shaping Magics allowed for the creation of magic items, something very much lacking in the original system.

3rd Edition radically altered the skill/rank system that was a core mechanic of previous. While this does streamline the game, it fundamentally alters the experience of playing.

55694.name: Fantasy Gamer's Compendium
55694.description:
From the front cover:

"Contains the complete Books of Mystery, Monsters, Demons, Sorcery, Shamans and Treasures. This fantasy role-playing supplement works with all systems."

Revised & Expanded edition includes "Treasures I/II"

User Summary:

The Books of Mystery sets up a new character class, the "Lords of Mystery." Monsters and Demons are what you would think, Sorcery and Shamans are spells and class differences from standard Magic Users. Treasure contains items from Earth lore and mythology; Treasures II has items from the science fiction future.

55697.description:
This description was originally based on a review from BoardgameNews.com.

In this corporation-themed game, players compete to be the first to acquire four out of six possible victory points. You earn a point by reaching certain numbers along tracks, such as at least 7 on the influence track or 8 on the majority track. You also may earn a point by beating your secretly assigned archenemy on three specified tracks.

The game lasts a number of rounds, with each round consisting of a directors' meeting, followed by 4-7 turns. At the meeting, the "company chairman" is replaced (the next token in line moves up) and the "division heads" are named (by seeing who has the majority in each column of placed cubes). Chairmen and heads get salary bonuses and a card detailing a single advantage for the cardholder.

The player who's the "communications" head then secretly looks at the Event cards and determines in which order they will be played (and so how many turns will be in the current round). Other heads' cards will let them pay less for stocks, for example, or place or remove bits.

After each event card is revealed, players select one action to perform, such as "hiring and relocating employees" (placing or moving cubes), resigning as a department head, using an advantage card, or bribing players for their advantage cards. These actions result in points on the scoring tracks and sometimes money (which is only used for bribery and buying blocks of stock). A bribed card has more power than an earned one, giving incentive to accept bribes (the card is less useful or even useless to the original owner, depending on the workers' happiness scale). In addition to bribery getting you a power you want, it also moves you up the corruption track. A player who rejects a bribe, however, loses one cube on the majority columns.

It's not a business simulation, and gameplay isn't as dastardly as the theme implies. The event cards provide most of the humor. (The card may read that you have failed to fix the breakroom game table, or vacations were canceled, so worker satisfaction goes down, which is what you want). The feel of rising through the ranks (getting more points) is there, and there are many things to attempt to excel in, by doing various business-related (at least in name) actions. Efficient manipulating of your opportunities will win you victory points and, if you gain four, the game.

Awards:
Machtspiele (Power $truggle) is derived from "Die Firma", which won a special prize in the 2009 Hippodice game design competition for best full-length game.

55698.name: Beneath Black Towen
55698.description:
Publisher blurb:

Once again evil threatens The Land Of Song and heroes must be found.

An adventure for characters of level 4-6.

55700.name: Where the Fallen Jarls Sleep
55700.description:
Publisher blurb:

A malevolence darkens the northern reaches of The Land of Song. Can your group defeat the evil and bring peace?

An adventure for characters of level 3-5.

55702.name: Stratrivia
55702.description:
Enhance any Trivia game with a dose of Strategy!

The objective of Stratrivia is to get the highest score in two ways: answering Trivia Questions correctly and controlling as many Strat Squares at the end of the game as possible.
You do this by moving your piece around the Trivia Board by rolling dice and winning strategic squares on the Strat Board by answering trivia questions correctly (which also give you points).

A+A Games is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution-Noncommercial-Share Alike 2.5 South Africa LicenseBased on the work distributed at Board Game Geek.

55703.name: CAPITAL+
55703.description:
Business game: investments, sales, purchases.

CAPITAL+ is a game of business initiation, for any person 10+ of age, which can be played successfully by the entire family.

Every player is a business person, who has his/her own capital. The capital is invested in the building of industries in various capital cities from Europe.

The industries can be: Consumer Goods Industries (Clothes, Food, Drugs, Installations, Furniture and Computers) and Public Industries (Water, Gas, Transport, Construction, Communicatons and Electricity).

These industries produce different goods; these goods can be sold to the other business partners, also, in some conditions, to the cities.

In order for the industries to function, raw materials must be bought and salaries must be paid. Loans can be taken from the bank, by mortgaging one or many industries.

55704.name: Resurrección
55704.description:
In Spanish the original:

Pantalla del árbitro para el juego Exo que incluye una aventura en la que se perfila por primera vez la maldad de los iroiendi y se desvela el secreto de los skardar. Incluye la descripción de un sector fronterizo del espacio entre la República Federal de Planetas y la Comunidad Verriana.

In English:

GM screen for Exo game which includes an adventure where the iroendi evil is seen for first time and the skardar secret is foreseen. Includes the description of a space sector between the Federal Republic of Planets and the Verrian Comunity

55705.description: Callisto’s brilliant design, including a board that changes surface according to the number of players present, is among one of the features that make this game so unique. While the goal is simple–to be the first player to place all of his/her tiles onto the board-the shapes of the tiles and additional columns make winning quite tricky. The game plays out like a competitive puzzle, and finesse and cunning are required to triumph.
55705.name: Callisto: The Game

55706.name: Ren Faire
55706.description:
You and your friends are newbies at the Renaissance faire. Food, music, mock combat ... it sounded like some kind of off-beat rock concert! Problem is, you stick out like a sore thumb. In a crowd of buccaneer hats and faerie wings, you're the only ones in shorts and t-shirts. Now you and your friends have one afternoon to assemble the ultimate Renaissance costume, but you're low on cash and the only way to earn more is to perform for the crowd!

In Ren Faire, your goal is to outfit your character with costumes whose icons fill the slots on it. To do this, you play performance cards that award you coins for doing silly stunts, then buy the transparent costume cards that stack above your character card.

Ren Faire – a light-hearted card game for 2 to 4 players, ages 13 and up – features an innovative transparent card design, and performance cards that are sure to keep everyone enjoying the game.

55707.name: Socca Dice
55707.description:
Socca Dice is a little dice game with 2 dice, one with green ink and one with red ink. It is a step by step dice rolling game.

The players start with the green die. The sides are Pass, Free-Kick, Shoot, Penalty, Robbed, Throw-In which decides if you can throw the dice again, loose and give the dice to another player, or use the red die next.

The sides of the red dice are: Corner, Missed, Cleared, Saved and Goal, the let the player throw again the die, hands the dice to the next player or the goal finishes the round with one point.

The two dice comes along with the rules. The back of the rules can be used as Scoring Chart

Similar to Soccer Dice, albeit with different die faces.

55708.name: City of London
55708.description:
The aim is to become Lord Mayor of the City of London. The game is played on a map of the City of London which is divided into 25 Wards and features a route through the City from Old Bailey to the Mansion House and beyond. 20 Wards contain 3 Ward Seats.

Players first gain Wards, using Ward Cards to gain a Seat Majority. They become elected to four Wards in succession using Election Cards and answering questions correctly. As each Ward is won, players move up the ranks from Freeman, Councilman, Liveryman to Alderman. Now the aim is to become a Sheriff by travelling from Old Bailey to Guildhall.

Sheriffs then travel through the City on a route to the Mansion House that includes the Lord Mayor's Show procession. En route players answer questions and retain correctly answered cards which bear points.

If a Sheriff arrives at the Mansion House with 5 or more question cards they can become Lord Mayor at Guildhall. If no other Sheriifs are on the City route, the Lord Mayor wins outright. Otherwise the Lord Mayor travels from Guildhall towards Mansion House trying to remove the remaining Sheriffs before they reach the safety of their own Wards. A points tally of the top 5 cards determines whether or not the Lord Mayor beats the Sheriffs.

55709.name: Dharma Book: Devil-Tigers
55709.description:
From the publisher:

We Are the Devils of Heaven
Ours is not the casual evil of the murderer in the alley or the butchery of men. We are those whom Heaven has mandated to bring suffering to the world. We are those who have been told to make all of creation howl with pain and fear. We are those entrusted with the flaying of the Universe. And we enjoy our work. . . very, very much.

We Are the Harbingers of the Sixth Age
Dharma Book: Devil-Tigers is the first in the series of Dharma Books for Kindred of the East, following in the tradition of Vampire's Clanbooks. It details the powers, secrets and hidden agendas of the Devil-Tigers. Outsiders consider these undead monsters, wanton killers, infernalists or beasts. Those who follow this Dharma only laugh at such notions. The truth, you see, is far, far worse.

55710.name: Expedição KV62
55710.description:
3d Boardgame in the tomb of Tuthankamon...you need reach first the Sarcophage. In the Upper board you need reach the seven passages for the lower board. Each player play with 4 peons.
The game has a Dice based movement and the objective is to be the first player a reach the Sarcophage Chamber in the Lower Board. Each player can in your movement put obstacles in the path of the adversaries for stop your movement.

55711.name: Queops
55711.description:
3d game...the players are a group of explorer trying find the Inner Chamber in the Queops Piramid. A good game for play with the family and friends. Beautiful board.
Gameplay - the game movement is based in rolling a dice and moving the number rolled in a path. Is possible in your move take cards with advantages or with troubles in your way for inside the Piramid. The Inner board in the piramid has a mechanism for rotate the board and change the tiles, creating Holes or troubles for the peons inside.
The objective of the game is to be the first player to reach the Sarcophage chamber inside the piramid and return for your starting tile.

55712.name: !G - Rated G
55712.description:
Subtitle: The Roleplaying Game of Saturday Morning Fantasy Violence

Publisher's description:

!G is alien gunslingers facing off at three different high noons - one for each sun. It's swords versus circuitry, as twelve year old card wielding duelists face off against teams of mutant superteens. It is mighty thewed barbarians pitting their biceps against the robot dreadnaughts of Señor Apocalypso. In short, it's anything your heart desires.

!G is rules light and fun heavy.

55713.name: Adventurers Club (Issue 18 - Summer 1992)
55713.description:
User Summary:

Adventurers Club #18 appeared in Summer 1992 and features one of the more dynamic AC covers (by George Perez). This marked the third issue in a row with a different editor or editing team. It also features a number of articles by Aaron Allston.

Departments

- 'Nuff Said by Bill Robinson
- Superhype! by Bruce Harlick

Features

- Weapons Combat: A martial arts style for fantasy campaigns by Aaron Allston
- Champions: The Computer Game - Preview of the upcoming Champions computer game by Bruce Harlick
- Palomon: The Cursed King - An encounter in for Mythic Greece by Aaron Allston
- The House That Jack Built: A big Champions setting/scenario by Scott Heine & Steven Holmes
- Hack Writing: A none-too-serious Martial Art by Aaron Allston
- Empire Club: Ham-Hand's (The Black Pearl): The Black Pearl, a setting for Justice, Inc. Encounters by Aaron Allston

News From the Hero Auxiliary Central

Adventurers Club #19 appeared in Winter 1993 and features a Fantasy Hero scenario, The Murder of Lord Ernesto.

Departments

- Superhype! by Monte Cook

Features

- The Murder of Lord Ernesto: A huge Fantasy Hero Scenario by L. Douglas Garrett
- Another Look at Vehicles: The Hero System vehicle rules revisited by Wayne Shaw
- News From the Hero Auxiliary Central: The latest updates from HACS
- Hoarding Dragons: Guidelines for using Dragons in Fantasy Hero by Bryce Nakagawa
